org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: Territory of Washington vs. M.A. Walker Charles Walker Helen Walker } Murder
The above named defendants were brought before me by virtue of a warrant issue of by the coroner of Pierce County, Washington Territory, charged with the murder of one William Lockwood.

A.H. Thompson, William Vale, Walter Osgood, T.W. Kirkbride, Jay, U. Kelly, Grace Hunter, Emma Arnold, Henry Lockwood, William Hunter, Mary Whitam, H.F. WcKay, James Wintermart, Robert Albright, George Reich, E.H. Sherman, Henry Locke, R.M. Downey, Peter Fulmer, and F.C. Miller, were sworn and examined for the Territory.
T.A. Ward, Framer E. Foresting, Mary Whitam, George Reich, T.C. Miller and E.M. Brown were sworn for defense.

The Court after hearing all the evidence offer in the case finds that there is us probable cause to believe that the defendants Charles Walker and Helen Walker are guilty of the offense charged, and that there is probable cause to believe that the defendant M.A. Walker has been guilty of the murder of William
